name: Leather purses
description:
A perfect grouping of sizes and colours. Our leather zip purses are made from metallic or patterned leather as well as our much loved un-dyed leather. The un-dyed leather will change colour and sheen from contact with your skin, from a pale neutral - to a warm nutty brown. 

Each purse is lined in vintage Japanese wool and closed with an organic cotton and brass zip. All purses have an un-dyed leather cord.

Large - 42 x 31cm. Perfect for laptop, folders and paperwork, or as a oversized foldover clutch.

Small - 31 x 20cm. Perfect clutch or bag within a bag.

Coin - 14 x 12cm. Coins and cards

name: Antique glass lamp base two
description:
This beautiful green glass lamp base has been converted from 19th century French Wine flask.

It has been professionally rewired and tested, has lovely chrome bayonet bulb holders and black braided silk flex.

The shapes and colours of these lamp bases do vary, and there are some imperfections within the glass due to their age - but we like them like that.

44cmH x 26cm W at base.

Sold without shade.

name: Metallic leather wheat cushions
description:
Lovely metallic leather front with a British woven linen backing and a zip enclosure. Filled with a separate unscented buckwheat hull cushion inner.

Two colours - old gold or silver.

35cm x 20cm

name: Cloth
description:
Cassandra's new book is an inspirational guide to cotton, linen, silk, wool and hide with over 30 beautiful contemporary projects.

Organised into five sections – Cotton, Wool, Silk, Linen and Hide – Cloth provides insight into their extraordinary colour, craftsmanship and history and includes 30 innovative projects from tote bags and aprons to cushions and simple silk curtains that will enable you to create striking and personal pieces. 

With a resource guide containing all the information you need to indulge a passion for textiles, such as where to buy antique fabrics, suppliers of organic and ethically-sourced cloth, specialist shops and websites.

Please note that you are pre-ordering. Cloth will be dispatched to you signed and gift-wrapped, from October 17th.

name: Antique glass wine bottle two
description:
These are amazing (and enormous) glass bottles. Wonderful as a vase, or just a piece for home. We can also convert these to lamps which will take 7-14 working days from order.

The shapes and colours of these bottles do vary, and there are some imperfections within the glass due to their age - but we like them like that. This bottle has been repaired with lead, which looks fantastic.

name: Hand dyed Silk velvet cushion
description:
Our signature cushion.

Each piece of silk velvet is individually dyed using natural dyes. 
Every cushion will have a variation in dye colour and markings due to the nature of dyeing. 
The cushions are backed with a British woven rustic linen, filled with a feather insert and have a zipper closure.

Too lovely.

name: Duralex gigogne glasses
description:
The classic French tumbler - used in schools and canteens everywhere.
Perfect for hot or cold drinks, big and small people.

Set of four.

name: Antique silk patchwork wheat cushion five
description:
These are just beautiful. Carefully selected vintage and antique silk are pieced to create unique cushions. They have a British woven linen backing and a zip enclosure. 

Filled with a separate unscented buckwheat hull cushion inner.

35cm x 20cm

name: Indigo quilt - Quilt Love sample
description:
This quilt was made in our studio by Cassandra Ellis for the book Quilt Love. It is made from Japanese, African, British, American and Indian vintage silk, cotton and wools. It is backed in cotton with a cotton/bamboo filling.

Approx 210Wcm x 200Lcm.

We think of these as 'sample' quilts, so is a great opportunity to own a bespoke quilt for less than half of the normal cost.

name: Hungarian vintage linen cushions
description:
These are so lovely. Roughly textured, hand woven vintage Hungarian linen. Backed in British woven linen, filled with a feather insert and enclosed with a zip.

45cm x 45cm.

name: Antique glass lamp base one
description:
This beautiful celadon green glass lamp base has been converted from 19th century French Wine flask.

It has been professionally rewired and tested, has lovely chrome bayonet bulb holders and black braided silk flex.

The shapes and colours of these lamp bases do vary, and there are some imperfections within the glass because of their age.

40cmH x 29cmW at widest point

Sold without shade.

name: Antique wooden dough bowl four
description:
These bowls are stunning and increasingly hard to come by - this one is particularly beautiful. From Hungary, they are hand-carved from a single piece of wood. Their condition is reflective of their age but we think the hand-made look and tactile feel of these bowls are perfect. All bowls have been cleaned and waxed to condition the wood.

64cm x 37cm x 16cmH

description:

name: French Vintage Armchairs
description:
1940's French club chairs. We love these chairs. A great snug shape and clean lined - the kind of chair that you can use in almost every room and style of home.  Solid condition but will need reupholstering and recovering.

Price is per chair.

name: One quilt day workshop
description:
This option offers the perfect balance between learning to make your own quilt and commissioning my studio to make one for you

​Up to three people can join me to make one quilt for your special occasion (birthday, wedding, celebration of life, just because you have always wanted to). I work with you beforehand to help you chose the right design and then make sure make sure that you have all the fabric and tools you need.

You spend the day at my studio where you¹ll learn how to build your quilt from scratch. You'll learn how to follow a pattern, create blocks and experiment with different fabrics and colours to create your own heirloom quilt. At the end of the day, you should have a complete quilt top and it will  be ready for finishing, quilting and binding.

£295 for up to three people. This is a full day from 9.30am - 5pm in London and can be booked on a weekday only. The cost does not include fabric or quilting but we can arrange quilting for you once we¹ve completed your quilt top.

name: Antique wooden dough bowl three
description:

Their condition is reflective of their age but we think the hand-made look and tactile feel of these bowls are perfect. All bowls have been cleaned and waxed to condition the wood.

name: Quilt Love
description:
Few of us are fortunate enough to have a handmade quilt handed down through our family. This wonderful collection of 20 projects is presented in four chapters ‘Big Events’, ‘Love’, ‘Friendship’ and ‘Memories’.  It is also possible to improvise – patches from any of the designs can be sewn up to make a cushion cover, for example, or used as the building blocks for more elaborate designs. 

Piecing together patchwork and quilts is the perfect opportunity to recycle fabric and use up scraps to make something beautiful and significant. 

Signed and wrapped copy.
